question: Which of the following reports is not released by the World Economic Forum?
explanation:
World Economic Forum is a not-for-profit foundation established in 1971 and headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland. Major Reports and Indices by WEF are:
  • Global Competitiveness Report
  • Global Gender Gap Report
  • Global Human Capital Report
  • Inclusive Development Index
  • Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report
  • Global Energy architecture performance index report
In a recently released report by the World Economic Forum (WEF), India remains the most competitive country in South Asia. India ranked at 40th position in the global competitiveness ranking of 137 countries. As per WEF report, Switzerland is the worldâ€™s most competitive economy. Global Human Capital Index is released by World Economic Forum. India ranked low 103rd out of 130 countries surveyed for the Global Human Capital Index (GHCI) 2017. Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Index is again released by the World Economic Forum (WEF). India ranked at 40th position while Spain stood first in the index released in April 2017. The Global Financial Stability Report (GFSR) is released by the International Monetary Fund. The recently released report finds that the global financial system continues to strengthen in response to extraordinary policy support, regulatory enhancements, and the cyclical upturn in growth.
